publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-4584 Bill Butler: Homeopathy Awareness Week—That the Parliament notes that 14 to 21 July 2006 is Homeopathy Awareness Week; recognises that homeopathy has been seen to provide benefits to the mental and physical well-being of patients and is based on a multi-disciplinary, holistic, "whole-person care" model; welcomes the contribution that homeopathic medicine makes to the NHS by successfully treating a wide range of conditions, often after conventional medicine has failed; acknowledges the excellent results achieved through the imaginative approach pioneered by the Glasgow Homeopathic Hospital, the only one of its kind in the United Kingdom, and wishes the hospital, its staff and patients every future success. Supported by: Murray Tosh*, Christine May*, Mrs Nanette Milne*, Eleanor Scott*, Jackie Baillie*, Dr Elaine Murray*, Patrick Harvie*, Trish Godman*, Frances Curran*, Carolyn Leckie*, Mr Jamie Stone*, Bruce Crawford*

S2M-4584 Homeopathy Awareness Week (lodged on 20 June 2006) Tommy Sheridan*, Robin Harper*, Mike Pringle*, Stewart Stevenson*, Christine Grahame*, Mr David Davidson*, Cathie Craigie*, Alex Fergusson*, Mrs Mary Mulligan*, Chris Ballance*
S2M-4584 Homeopathy Awareness Week (lodged on 20 June 2006) Donald Gorrie*, Scott Barrie*, Janis Hughes*, Dave Petrie*, Helen Eadie*, Shiona Baird*
